MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY east lansing
RADIO STATIONS • WKAR • WKAR— FM
February 15, 1963
Miss Marion Corwell
Associate director
School Relations
Dearborn Public Schools
5757 Neckel Avenue
Dearborn, Michigan
Dear Miss Corwell:
Thank you so much for your letter of February 1, in response to my earlier
request for your opinion of my proposed research study of the public rela¬
tions practices of LTV.
Your comments and suggestions were most helpful, especially your suggestion
that I consider proposing a public relations program for the industry. As
somewhat of a coincidence, I think, I am engaged this quarter in setting up
a public relations program for WKAR as part of a "special problems" course
I am taking. However, I had never seriously considered undertaking a simi¬
lar project for educational television until you mentioned this possibility.
I also had doubts about the survey approach to my study, realizing quite
well the attitude people have toward questionnaires'. I do believe that I
would at least like to sample some of the things people in the industry
say they are doing about PR, but perhaps I may be able to do this on a more
limited scale than I had anticipated if I also include a proposed PR pro¬
gram in the study.
As you can see, I'm still in the "thinking" stage on this project, and that
is why I have found your suggestions so valuable. Incidentally, I have been
using the NALB PUBLIC RELATIONS KIT as an aid in setting up the WKAR pro¬
posed program.
Thanks again for your interest and assistance.
Sincerely yours.
R,
A< ^ _ .on Director
